posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for encounters are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of encounters to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

In our last session, we encountered a Lich and tried to use encounters to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about encounters. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
Our table uses a house rule for combat where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how combat works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

I think the 2024 changes to combat make it much more balanced compared to before.

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that encounters functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I've been playing a Half-Orc Barbarian in my campaign, and I've noticed that encounters really impacts how effective the character is in combat.
